intro: Aegiphila straminea, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, with a distinctive hairy texture. Aegiphila straminea is often found in open woodlands and along rocky slopes, where it thrives in full sun.
